p: To assure consistent differentiation of allo-specific Th1/CTL memory after allo-antigen priming, regardless of host immune status and age, a bioengineered, patented, immune cell called “AlloStim ®” is used. AlloStim ® is living, activated, intentionally mismatched, ex vivo expanded and differentiated allogeneic Th1-like cells derived from healthy donors. Injection of undifferentiated allogeneic immune cells or non-activated allogeneic immune cells were not able to elicit allo-specific Th1 memory, while priming with activated allogeneic Th1-like AlloStim ® cells elicited dominant Th1 immunity and had both a protective effect and a therapeutic effect in a cancer model [ 30, 31].
